AODCore.clientvars

Used to keep track of variables defined by the client. This mostly at the moment is just keybinds which give the user a direct interface to the console through keypresses. Since there are no native console commands, what the user can do is completely up to the application writer. In the future audio and display settings will be stored here.

struct Keybind;
A binded key

int key;
A valid SDL_SCANCODE or AOD.Mouse_Bind

string command;
A console command, in the majority of cases the user will probably expect the console command to occur when the 'key' is pressed

Keybind[] keybinds;
How you wish to use this is entirely up to you. For the majority of cases I'd expect the entire array to be iterated and if a key was pressed then the associated command would be executed. AOD does not touch this outside of Load_Config though for the majority of cases I'd expect the entire array to be iterated and if a key is pressed then the command will be executed.

void Load_Config();
Loads the user config from "config.ini" and stores results in keybinds.
Will clear keybinds beforehand
